meanings.definition: Relating to small-scale changes in gene frequency within a population over a short period of time.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the microevolutionary patterns in the local bird population.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained how microevolutionary processes can lead to genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The microevolutionary shifts in the insect community were like a tiny genetic dance.
meanings.sent4: Her research uncovered the subtle microevolutionary changes happening in the fish species.
meanings.sent5: The concept of microevolutionary shifts was illustrated through the changing fur colors of the rabbits.

meanings.definition: Involving adaptations and variations at the level of individual organisms within a species.
meanings.sent1: The zoo displayed various microevolutionary traits in their animal exhibits.
meanings.sent2: Microevolutionary characteristics can help species survive in changing environments.
meanings.sent3: The microevolutionary quirks of the squirrel made it a unique member of its species.
meanings.sent4: The idea of microevolutionary changes was as fascinating as a kaleidoscope of adaptations.
meanings.sent5: The microevolutionary features of the flowers were like tiny masterpieces of adaptation.
